question: What happens to a bar magnet of dipole moment (m) is placed in a uniform magnetic field (B)?
option1: the force on the bar magnet is zero
option2: the torque on the bar magnet is m × B
explanation: When a bar magnet of dipole moment m is placed in a uniform magnetic field B: (a) the force on it is zero, (b) the torque on it is m × B, (c) its potential energy is –m.B, where we choose the zero of energy at the orientation when m is perpendicular to B.
